texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: One of the first things I look for on a fresh installation of a laptop is how to enable tap-to-click automatically. Most window managers and desktop environments make this easy with a control panel that has toggles or drop-down menus.
texts.text: One of the first things I look for on a fresh installation of a laptop is how to enable tap-to-click automatically. Most window managers and desktop environments make this easy with a control panel that has toggles or drop-down menus.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: However, this requires a little more effort in i3. Fortunately, there are two routes to get it enabled: in xorg's configuration or via your i3 configuration.
texts.text: However, this requires a little more effort in i3. Fortunately, there are two routes to get it enabled: in xorg's configuration or via your i3 configuration.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Via the i3 configuration
texts.text: Via the i3 configuration

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The advantage of this method is that it's easy to configure and test out quickly. On the other hand, this configuration change will only affect i3 on your system. (Other window managers won't be affected.)
texts.text: The advantage of this method is that it's easy to configure and test out quickly. On the other hand, this configuration change will only affect i3 on your system. (Other window managers won't be affected.)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Start with the
texts.text: Start with the

texts.label: code
texts.orig: xinput
texts.text: xinput

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: command to determine which devices are on your system. If you're on Fedora, just run
texts.text: command to determine which devices are on your system. If you're on Fedora, just run

texts.label: code
texts.orig: dnf install xinput
texts.text: dnf install xinput

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: to install it.
texts.text: to install it.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Here's the output on my Lenovo ThinkPad T490:
texts.text: Here's the output on my Lenovo ThinkPad T490:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:

⎡ Virtual core pointer                    	id=2	[master pointer  (3)]
⎜   ↳ Virtual core XTEST pointer              	id=4	[slave  pointer  (2)]
⎜   ↳ SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad              	id=12	[slave  pointer  (2)]
⎜   ↳ TPPS/2 Elan TrackPoint                  	id=13	[slave  pointer  (2)]
⎣ Virtual core keyboard                   	id=3	[master keyboard (2)]
    ↳ Virtual core XTEST keyboard             	id=5	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Power Button                            	id=6	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Video Bus                               	id=7	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Sleep Button                            	id=8	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Integrated Camera: Integrated C         	id=9	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ Integrated Camera: Integrated I         	id=10	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ AT Translated Set 2 keyboard            	id=11	[slave  keyboard (3)]
    ↳ ThinkPad Extra Buttons                  	id=14	[slave  keyboard (3)]

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: My touchpad is the second entry in the first group:  SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad . Now we can list all the properties of this device using the id number (12 in my case) or the full name:
texts.text: My touchpad is the second entry in the first group:  SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad . Now we can list all the properties of this device using the id number (12 in my case) or the full name:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The important line in the output is this one:
texts.text: The important line in the output is this one:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: libinput Tapping Enabled (322):	0
texts.text: libinput Tapping Enabled (322):	0

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's turn on tap-to-click for the touchpad:
texts.text: Let's turn on tap-to-click for the touchpad:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1
texts.text: xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Your tap-to-click should now work! If it doesn't, go back to the list of input devices and double check that there isn't another touchpad. Some laptops show multiple touchpads even though there's only one in the system. This is due to extra buttons being labeled as a touchpad on some laptops.
texts.text: Your tap-to-click should now work! If it doesn't, go back to the list of input devices and double check that there isn't another touchpad. Some laptops show multiple touchpads even though there's only one in the system. This is due to extra buttons being labeled as a touchpad on some laptops.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Let's make it permanent in the i3 configuration. Open up
texts.text: Let's make it permanent in the i3 configuration. Open up

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ~/.config/i3/config
texts.text: ~/.config/i3/config

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and add a line:
texts.text: and add a line:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: exec xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1
texts.text: exec xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You're all set!
texts.text: You're all set!

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Via the xorg configuration method
texts.text: Via the xorg configuration method

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: This method affects all window managers on your machine, so keep that in mind. Make a new file at
texts.text: This method affects all window managers on your machine, so keep that in mind. Make a new file at

texts.label: code
texts.orig: /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/touchpad-tap.conf
texts.text: /etc/X11/xorg.conf.d/touchpad-tap.conf

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: and add the following:
texts.text: and add the following:

texts.label: code
texts.orig:
Section "InputClass"
        Identifier "libinput touchpad catchall"
        MatchIsTouchpad "on"
        MatchDevicePath "/dev/input/event*"
        Driver "libinput"
        Option "Tapping" "on"
EndSection
texts.text:
Section "InputClass"
        Identifier "libinput touchpad catchall"
        MatchIsTouchpad "on"
        MatchDevicePath "/dev/input/event*"
        Driver "libinput"
        Option "Tapping" "on"
EndSection

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: We're telling xorg to apply this configuration to any libinput touchpad on the system (but you could use the specific name of the device here if you want), and we're enabling the tapping option.
texts.text: We're telling xorg to apply this configuration to any libinput touchpad on the system (but you could use the specific name of the device here if you want), and we're enabling the tapping option.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: You can make this change effective immediately with:
texts.text: You can make this change effective immediately with:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1
texts.text: xinput set-prop "SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad" "libinput Tapping Enabled" 1

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The xorg configuration change takes effect when you log out of your X session or you reboot your computer.
texts.text: The xorg configuration change takes effect when you log out of your X session or you reboot your computer.

texts.label: paragraph
